text: This is the result of a two-dimensional simulation using `IncompressibleModel` with a `512x256` grid that demonstrates an inertial instability.  The left shows the perturbation zonal velocity and the right shows the perturbation buoyancy.  The results agree well with theory that can be found in a recent PhD thesis by Matthew Harris entitled "The Instability of Geophysical Flows: Two-layer Frontal Instabilities and Continuously Stratified Inertial Instabilities", co-supervised by Kevin Lamb and Francis Poulin.

text: Nice simulation! Are you defining  the perturbation as just the deviation from the initial background flow?
